website_summaries.verdict: A unique Timex wrist watch that blends traditional looks with a digital readout.
pros: Multipurpose digital readout can display several different functions such as a countdown timer and daily alarm
Comes in several different stainless steel colors
cons: The body of the watch is bulky and may feel heavy sitting on the top of the wrist

customer_reviews.title: Back again, 1992 boyyyeeeee
customer_reviews.text: This watch is awesome and makes me feel like it's 1992 again and I am a fake rich 13 year old. Someone said it's hard to set. You hold the set button until the numbers flash then you hit one of the other buttons to change them, like every other digital clock ever. Someone said it's made of plastic, no, it's made out of cheap aluminum which is exactly what you get for $26. Someone said it's small, and I can see that because I have little wimpy wrists. The indiglo works awesome, just like a new feature in 1992 should. I love this watch.
customer_reviews.author: Kristyn Todd

customer_reviews.title: A VERY DISAPPOINTING PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this watch in March. Two months later, the silver finish started coming off the plastic body of the watch. Today, (mid July), the expansion band broke, and the finish is almost entirely off the plastic housing. The warranty does not cover the body, the band or the battery. It does still keep time, so I guess I can remove the band and use it as a pocket watch!
customer_reviews.author: G W C

customer_reviews.title: I love the watch, but I hate stretch-expansion bands, so I had to change out the watchband right away!
customer_reviews.text: I love the watch, I had the exact watch in the 1980's. But I HATE the stretch-expansion band. I cannot wear that type of band. But wait, I still have my old watch from the 80's, not in great shape anymore, but the clasp-style band is in perfect condition. Because this is the "same" watch, I was able to swap the expansion band for the clasp style bracelet. In short, I give the watch 5 stars, but I deduct one for the awful stretch-expansion type band. I wish Timex would make this classic watch available with a clasp band, so that I wouldn't have had to do surgery.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: terrible quality
customer_reviews.text: The last several Timex watches like this have broken within months of ordering and using. I have used this watch for 20 years or so but in the last 4 years the quality of the case has declined so the case breaks at the band attachment. This watch used to last for years not months. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Terrible watch
customer_reviews.text: Instructions are to difficult to read and understand. It doesn't cost much and you get what you pay for. Others may like it, I don't. Will be buying another watch.
customer_reviews.author: TLHAWKSTER

customer_reviews.title: Great watch, terrible band
customer_reviews.text: Here’s the thing: I love this watch. I really do, but the wrist band is terrible. It is easily broken. I’m not just sour grapes, I’ve purchased four of these watches. I love all the features, it’s exactly what I want in a watch. And each time I’ve been so careful putting this watch on and off, carefully removing my arm from shirt and jacket sleeves to not get caught and still, it breaks. I would love to continue to wear this watch but I just can’t do a fifth one! And btw there are no appropriate band replacements for this model, sadly.
customer_reviews.author: xsnx

customer_reviews.text: the watch face is kinda dope. the band is not for a larger wrist. for a child of the 80s this was a fun buy but eventually i lost it with this band and busted it up. if u are at over a seven inch wrist i wouldnt bother unless you dont value blood circulation. replace the band. now with this model color there is a shimmer or shine or tint that keeps it on the darker side for me. i do wear glasses so theres that. but its the only watch i own with this characteristic. its a decent value especially for smaller wrist folks.
customer_reviews.author: R.

customer_reviews.title: Nice watch but no directions
customer_reviews.text: This watch was bought for my sister in law as an exact replacement after she broke the band on hers. This watch is mainly for a man but she used this watch after her father didn’t want it as she is very hard on things and can’t see well. The bands on this watch are hard to find and the price is pretty reasonable for the entire watch. We bought a new watch instead of replacing the band and battery in the old one. The only complaint I have about this watch is that it doesn’t come with directions. I had to google a video to find out how to set it.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine MurthaTop Contributor: Travel Guides & Tips

customer_reviews.title: Timex Classic Digital Silver Tone men's watch
customer_reviews.text: This is my husbands favorite watch and will not use any other! When he lost it he looked all over for another. I happened to check Amazon an was surprise to find it! It's a great watch for everyday wear. He wanted two ordered so he could keep one as a spare, unfortunately Amazon only had one left . Did I mention what a great price it was. Ordered the last one and they were to get more soon. Now the same watch is $10.00 more..Can't see paying $10.00 more for the same watch. But at least he got one at a super great price and he's happy.
customer_reviews.author: Schukai

customer_reviews.title: REALLY SHOULD HAVE INCLUDED INSTRUCTIONS
customer_reviews.text: The watch itself is fine, in fact really nice. HOWEVER, in lieu of explanations of how the various features work and how to set the watch, all they sent was a web address. It can be very frustrating if you are not familiar with this or that feature. The web site was NOT VERY HELPFUL AT ALL. I finally remembered enough to set everything properly, but Timex should do more than send a web address. In the future, I may consider alternatives. I came very close to giving it 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Zorac

customer_reviews.title: Batteries and Operation Instructions
customer_reviews.text: I've had this type of Timex for years with great results. However, when the battery goes bad don't try to replace it yourself in spite of the nice looking 4 screws on the back. Take it to a watch repair professional it isn't just a "take battery out put a new one in". Or since they are so inexpensive just buy a new watch. There were no instructions with the watch but I found everything I needed to know with a Google search for Timex and the model number.
customer_reviews.author: FordLover37

customer_reviews.title: Good watch but no instruction sheet.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch for my husband. It's his 3rd one. When this one needs replacing, he'll probably get another. It's attractive and easy to read, plus very affordable. I would have given it 5 stars, but it came with a warranty in several languages, but no instruction sheet. He had to find the one from his previous Timex T78677purchase , since some features are usually only set once when it's new and he didn't recall how to do that without seeing it again in print. Overall, a very good watch.
customer_reviews.author: L  woodswoman

customer_reviews.title: Met My Expectations
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new watch and I had used this same model before. This is a relatively simple digital watch, but it has the main features that I want: correct time, date, and day. It has other features that are not important to me but may be to others: alarm, stop watch, etc. It met my expectations. The one small complaint I have is that there are some sharp edges on the stainless steel expansion band. I don't necessarily find that to be a problem, but I am aware of it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph O.

customer_reviews.title: Links can be added or removed easily.
customer_reviews.text: Classic look. Im a stylish mid twenty year old from southern California and this fits my style perfectly. It's unassuming but certainly a subtle eye catcher. From a functionality standpoint it's top notch. Simple watch for those who don't have a constant need to be connected to their phone all the time... Links CAN be added or removed. It's quite easy. Took me about 10 minutes with minimal effort.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Lenzen

customer_reviews.title: Timex Watch
customer_reviews.text: I would buy this again. I like timex better then casio. the display of time and date is easier to see because it is a little bigger. I been wearing the same watch for 20 years. Battery is a little difficult to replace. But the lense is mostly scratched up so time to buy new anyway. Battery lasted five years.
customer_reviews.author: David Grimes

customer_reviews.title: Easy to get the time down to the second
customer_reviews.text: Three things: This has a button to push that illuminates the face of the watch. I wish the illumination would stay on for four or five seconds after you let go of the button instead of turning off immediately. I ordered the watch with the larger twist band and it's still too small and uncomfortable on my wrist. Finally, you don't get directions for the watch in the package, you have to go to a web site. The information provided on the back on my watch pulled up directions for an analog watch (instead of digital). An email to Timex resulted in the instructions being mailed to me as a PDF.
customer_reviews.author: Woodward

customer_reviews.title: Great watch but band is small
customer_reviews.text: Timex T78587 Pros: Easy to read Good quality Band doesn’t pinch or pull hair Hourly beep Day/Date/Month Alarm Stopwatch Indiglo (blue light) Water resistance 30M Cons: Doesn’t come with manual Band is expandable but small (I've small wrist, fits me perfectly) Final thoughts: Nice (retro) looking watch, you can google watch name and model to find user manual. Band is small so if you have big wrist then this watch isn’t for you.
customer_reviews.author: Moon

customer_reviews.title: The band does not expand!!!
customer_reviews.text: The watch is fine. The description of the band is very misleading. It looks like an expansion band and it does everything but expand. This watch has a solid non expanding band. If you really want an expansion band do what I did. As a loyal Amazon customer, I searched Amazon and couldn't find a watch with a real expansion band. I finally went to K-Mart and got the exact same watch with a real stretch expansion band. The one I bought from Amazon regretfully is going back.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: PLEASE READ BEFORE ORDERING LARGER BAND
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for myself because my eyesight isn't what it used to be. I found it easy to read, so I bought the larger band (more money) for my husband. He tried it and found it to be too small. I checked the measurements and they were exactly the same as mine. So we exchanged it. The new one arrived. The box looked like it was the same box I returned (damaged). We measured this one and it was exactly the same. So we ended up returning. Not free, I had to pay $6.00 shipping. If they ship the wrong item, I should not have to pay for shipping. That's my feeling. Finally, the watch itself is good.
customer_reviews.author: GKW

customer_reviews.title: GOOD WATCH. LOUSY, OR NO, INSTRUCTIONS
customer_reviews.text: When I wear my MagnaClick shirts I need an anti magnetic watch. This watch fits the bill. It keeps excellent time and is relatively good looking. However, it came with no instructions and the Timex Web Site is not very instructive. It took unnecessary time and effort to finally get the proper settings, etc. In fact I found a short Youtube
customer_reviews.author: RON WHITE

customer_reviews.title: Features not clear
customer_reviews.text: I returned this watch because, although it appeared to be the same as an older model that I needed to replace, it actually did not have all of the functions. The product description (even what little I could find on the Timex website) was so vague that I could not tell whether it had certain functions that I needed. (Although there were implications that it offered the functions, it actually didn't - for instance, it lacked a count-down timer, etc. and some of the other functions were "abbreviated versions").
customer_reviews.author: TechnoJunkie

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply built and not made to fit
customer_reviews.text: The band is too big for my wrist and there was no way to choose a wrist size at checkout. The buttons are tiny and uncomfortable to press, and the light only stays on as long as you're holding the button down, digging into your finger. The navigation is also very unintuitive compared to other similarly-priced or cheaper watches I've bought in the past. I wish there were other, better-made digital watches with flex bands on the market, but this seems to be the only one I can find.
customer_reviews.author: Xelrog

customer_reviews.title: Vintage casual look.
customer_reviews.text: Cool watch. Love the vintage 80s look. By no means is it high end. You get what you pay for. Difficult to see during the day without the indiglo switch. I think they could have made the watch band a bit tighter since it does stretch to fit. My wrist is about 7+ inches and it feels somewhat loose, but not to the point where it’s falling down my arm. It does provide a fashionable, casual, everyday look. Best paired with t-shirt and jeans. Not suitable as a dress watch.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Band was really small for my husband. He didn't like the watch. He had had one years ago like this and lost it. This watch was a bit different than the other one. It also didn't come with instructions on how to set it. You have to go to their website for instructions and the watch was not listed and we couldn't find it on their website anywhere. Another problem. They have included a big sheet of paper saying to go to the website in every language there is. They could have just as easily printed the setting instructions instead. We sent the watch back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Athena Dedrick

customer_reviews.title: No instruction
customer_reviews.text: This watch packing T78587 does not provide any instruction on how to" set "the watch nor any of is other features. None are included. I worked over 4 hours punching buttons on the watch in random sequences. Was finally able through this trial and error method to set the time of day-- withing two minutes. Have not tried to utilize any other features. If I hadn't had to return two previous watches, one damaged in transit and one with instruction so small I had to read them with a magnifying glass. I will keep this watch since it is set to keep time and does that very well.
customer_reviews.author: Whilhein

customer_reviews.title: Glad they still make this model !
customer_reviews.text: My husband has had this particular Timex watch for quite a number of years. This is his third purchase. My only problem with Timex is there are no instructions on setting it. There should be a link to download a manual for those of us who like to read what we're doing. I went into Youtube and found someone demonstrating a Timex that was very similar.
customer_reviews.author: K. Meister

customer_reviews.title: Just needed a reliable digital watch
customer_reviews.text: I never take this off. I used to have a Rolex and got sick of it. Then I had a fitness watch but was not accurate and my phone covers fitness data better (use Mapmywalk app). So, I just needed a digital I could see in the sun and not worry about taking a shower with it on or washing dishes. This works great. Face is getting scratched but no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: just what my dad wanted
customer_reviews.text: Was happy to find this style available, with the stretch band that my senior-aged dad prefers. One annoyance, the slip of paper it came with said to search for the user's manual online by style number on the Timex website, but that only brought up the manual for a different analog style watch. Timex website has yet to respond with how to get the actual user's manual, but I was able to figure out the basic settings to get the watch running for dad.
customer_reviews.author: A. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to set
customer_reviews.text: I thought this beautiful gold digital watch was exactly what I had been looking for. I downloaded the user guide, followed instructions, could not set the date, or reset the time (which I finally was able to set) to EST. I called Timex - said they had design problems that made it hard to set. I got the 5-year service contract for $5 I'll c all Timex again to see of they can help,
customer_reviews.author: marinermark

customer_reviews.title: watch loses time at night
customer_reviews.text: Every night the watch loses 1 1/2 hours time sometime during the night when I am sleeping. I will wake up and the watch says 4:15 am but the time is really 5:30 AM. I have had a jeweler look at it and say it is not the battery. It has to be something in the watch. The return date has expired so I am stuck with it. Will get a better watch the next time. First Timex watch that I have owned that I have had a problem like this.
customer_reviews.author: Classic Rock Fan

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes what's old is new again.  And in a good way.
customer_reviews.text: I have a small fleet of G shocks and some are pretty big. Most are uncomfortable. All are sweaty. I thought about when I was a kid when I had a normal no frills digital watch and how much I enjoyed it. So I searched on "retro digital watch" and found this one It's just like you remember- that is they wear without you noticing them on your wrist. Simple operation and with my aging eyes easy to read with a nice background, large numbers, and indiglo. I got the extra long and it fits me well. I don't know why I waited so long.
customer_reviews.author: Vince L.

customer_reviews.title: This watch breaks easily, has no directions
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, this watch breaks easily. I have had 3 of this model and on every one the the tab on the side that holds the pin for attaching the band broke, The last two in less than one year. Why do I keep buying it? I like the time-keeping functions and, after all of these years, I don't have to look at the directions any more to know how to control the functions. That's fortunate because this watch and my last one both came with no directions on how to use the buttons to control the watch functions.
customer_reviews.author: Synchromash

customer_reviews.title: Nice Watch With One Important Shortcoming
customer_reviews.text: For an inexpensive digital watch it is pretty nice withba better than expected display. It was easy to figure out how to set times without using the instructions. The expanding band is a feature I wish more watches had. This band is barely big enough for my wrist. The reason I knocked off two stars is the function buttons are hard to push. This watch is made in China but better buttons would have elevated it over more costly watches.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a wristwatch??????
customer_reviews.text: Read and followed the instructions a lot of times and there is simply NO WAY to set this watch!!! I live in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania and this watch keeps showing the time in Lower Mongolia or some other place I think on earth or Pluto or wherever. Nice light-weight paperweight though. Other than that, totally useless!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: rayco

customer_reviews.title: Owned a watch like this for at least 40 years.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a watch like this for at least 40 years. It is one of the best, most rugged time pieces that a man would ever want. Unfortunately I have to buy a new one every twenty to thirty years because I live in central Illinois which has very, very high heat and humidity and I will eventually sweat into the little buttons which makes them unworkable after many years of constant wear. Other than that, this is a great watch for all around activities.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Where were the instructions???
customer_reviews.text: The package include warranty information in approximately eight different languages, but no instructions on how to properly set the watch's time and date functions, which is problematic with learning how to operate a watch with, as you can see, four different buttons on it. It took a whole lot of frustrating trial and error to figure out which button did what and, at 75 years old, I have obviously since forgotten the function of each of the buttons. The only redeeming factor is the low cost of the watch means I won't have any heartache about just throwing the damn thing in the trash instead of experiencing the frustrations of trying to set it again.
customer_reviews.author: William Oppel

customer_reviews.title: Great Item
customer_reviews.text: My husband has had one of these watches for many years and we were so happy to find the exact same watch for him. He is still wearing the old one but really in need of a new better looking one. I can tell you he is rough on a watch and this has stood the test of time with him. I will update on the new one after Christmas but would recommend this as a good every day watch.
customer_reviews.author: Linda McCall

customer_reviews.title: A Classic
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Timex watch of this design. Typically, it will run about two or so years, depending on how often I use the light to see the time at night. Batteries are never easily replaced unless you have jeweler tools. I don't and because this watch is relatively low-cost, I prefer to replace it, rather than have the battery replaced by a jeweler. Recycle the watch as you would any electronic product. I have always been happy with this watch and its design, which is why I will always purchase this model as long as it is available.
customer_reviews.author: Old Timer Too

customer_reviews.title: The case does not stand sunny weather
customer_reviews.text: The watch description says “Durable and Lightweight Silver-Tone Resin Case”. After I wore the watch on hot sunny days for a week or two, the Silver-Tone case changed to ugly mucus-like resin on both sides. The watch still shows time correctly, but would you use it, especially in public?
customer_reviews.author: Pushkin-Yevtiushkin

customer_reviews.title: Great watch, terrible band
customer_reviews.text: Great watch, just what I wanted, but the band is the stretch out kind, which I've always disliked. I knew that before I bought it, thanks to other reviews, and was able to use the band on my old, and sadly broken Timex from 1995. Have had it for 3-4 months now, working fine and without issues.
customer_reviews.author: IK

customer_reviews.title: Easy, reliable, waterproof, oil proof and  easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Works great, fits good (I have small wrists) and ppl like it. I keep getting them, about once a year. I’m rough on them and never take it off basically. I’ve had about 6 of these. Wish they had a couple different colors or band options. Waterproof and reliable but scratch easy. I’d rather have a new watch every year or two then an expensive one I would tear up. Besides ppl like it, they might laugh at it but it’s practical and from a distance looks decent. Recommend for everyday use but not for impressing if you’re into that.
customer_reviews.author: Charliejo

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the $$
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for a Casio that was over 20 years old but still working. Would have given it 5 stars if it had come with instructions on how to use all the functions without having to go to the internet. Still have not figured out how to adjust the band - internet instructions too?
customer_reviews.author: William P. Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Third in a row
customer_reviews.text: This is a great classic watch. Easy to read time and date. I like this watch so much that this is the third time I bought it. The other two are still working, I just replace the batteries and they are still going. They last for years (it must have been over 5 years ago when i bought the 2nd one). If you need a great watch this one does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: No better watch in world for reliable time, calandar w/alarm & stopwatch
customer_reviews.text: About every 5-8 years I have to buy a new one of this indigo model Timex watch. They still work, but the battery finally wears down and the watch shows a lot of wear from the beating I give it. As John Cameron Suezy used to say after he pulled a Timex of an Outboard motor prop: "They take a licking and keep on ticking". Holding true today and with atomic clock near perfect time, there is no better wrist watch in the world for reliably giving you the time, day, week, month and year with a built in alarm clock and stopwatch to boot. All for a $20 bill & change.
customer_reviews.author: Enjuneer

customer_reviews.title: An awesome retro inspired watch for the money.
customer_reviews.text: A solid retro watch for the price. Timex being known for reliable “dad-watches”, has once again struck fake gold with this one. The indiglo is such a cool feature that has come in handy more times than I’d like to admit, waking up in the middle of the night, slapping at my wrist to find out how much sleep I have left before work. All in all, it’s been reliable and pragmatic. It scratches easily, but so would you if were sold for $30 brand new.
customer_reviews.author: mightymo 81

customer_reviews.title: Keeps on ticking
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this watch for everyday use. It just works in the pool and out of the pool. His last one like this lasted about 20 years and we were happy that we could find this one which is just like the old one. Timex makes a great inexpensive product worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Sabes

customer_reviews.title: Amazon has no customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Worst Amazon experience ever. Watch quit working 1 day after return window. Amazon solution was to send watch back to Timex. Both the Amazon representative and the Timex representative were very challenged with the English language and were not at all helpful on the procedures required. This is a $30 watch and after spending an hour trying to get this done with absolutely no help I just threw this 30 day old watch in the trash. Shame on you Amazon and shame on you Timex. As a result of this I will be searching for alternatives to Amazon. They obviously make no attempt to back up their products.
customer_reviews.author: Tab Mefford

customer_reviews.title: Best inexpensive watch I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd watch in the last 30 years, exactly the same watch. When my 2nd one finally started to give me trouble, I was afraid I would not find another one like it... I almost bought 2 to make sure I have another one ready when and if this one stops. Great watch!
customer_reviews.author: Greg Fedo

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch, Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch. I have had three of the same watch over the years and they have all worked fine. The watch tells you the day, time and will alarm. It can also keep up with the seconds. It can be compared to one of those expensive watches but cost less. You will love it.
customer_reviews.author: Ruso Minnifield

customer_reviews.title: Long time user
customer_reviews.text: I have had at least three of these same watches over several decades. Although for daily use, I have an iWatch and a Casio automatic, I prefer this Timex for travel and the ease of changing time when passing to various time zones - including international travel. This watch is my "travel favorite!"
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: 2nd Time Owning This Type of Wristwatch
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item through Amazon Online with no negative problems. I owned an identical watch for many years previous but it finally died, but I liked it so much that I ordered this identical type of watch. It worked perfectly right out of the shipping package. I would not hesitate to recommend this type of watch to others.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Hotchkiss

customer_reviews.title: The watch itself would be fine. I have a very large wrist and the ...
customer_reviews.text: The watch itself would be fine. I have a very large wrist and the ad for this led me to believe the expansion band would fit large wrist. It definitely won't. It will go on your wrist okay but after a few minutes it will be cutting off your circulation. A waste of money for me.
customer_reviews.author: John T. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Product!
customer_reviews.text: The watch had a defect and the band of the watch had a malfunction because it came undone, thus in my opinion, this item that I bought was a piece of junk. I am shipping the item back to the seller for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Frederick Brown RN, MSN, & PhD

customer_reviews.title: The display is very dark.
customer_reviews.text: The display shown online is very easily read, and the crystal seems clear. The watch I received has a dark crystal on it which makes the display harder to see, especially in low lighting. I have purchased that very watch a few times in the past many years and the crystal was always clear.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky S

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for going on 2 years now and I am HIGHLY SATISFIED! Its beautiful, and i will say it has stretched but it isn't a noticeable stretch or an "extreme" stretch (It only stretched like a few micrometers if that even matters to the technical people) Still fits my wrist, and I use it as an everyday watch, and folks from the 80's always compliment me with the watch (I was born in '92 so the look on their faces when they see me with the watch on is hilarious and cool af)
customer_reviews.author: Ryan E

customer_reviews.title: Cheap watch band.
customer_reviews.text: This watch replaced a similar Casio watch that I've had for years.I like the face on this more as the numbers are a little larger. The band was too tight on me so replaced it with a better quality one. Odd that it doesn't track the year when setting the date so you have to tell it the day also. It beeps on the hour and I have to check the manual online to get it to stop.
customer_reviews.author: 911 Fellow

customer_reviews.title: I am not sure the quality of this watch is up to Tinex usual standards.
customer_reviews.text: I like timed watches. I work outdoors and they are normally very sturdy. I haven't had this watch very long and it has not been worn in a situation that would case damage. The band broke and I was very disappointed. I will still be able to use the watch but will have to purchase a new band.
customer_reviews.author: Tre977

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this watch a few times for many years. I wear my timex daily and work in dust and granular substance that sticks to it especially when I sweat or get wet from rain. I take my watch off and wash it under a faucet and the only times I have had to replace them, was when the watch controls stuck from the abuse from all the dust that had harden and I could not repair them. I also have a spare of a different color to wear when dressed up and going out. The only watch I have ever owned in my 76 years.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Gene

customer_reviews.title: Nostalgia
customer_reviews.text: No time set instructions. But, by using instructions for ‘similar’ digital watches on the internet was able to figure it out without wasting too much time. You really have to have the ‘ideal’ wrist to comfortably match the wristband. By using a sweatband I am able to wear it with comfort. This was a nostalgic birthday present. As such, it is a fun gift.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Silverman

customer_reviews.title: Nothing was right!!
customer_reviews.text: Would’ve been great if I actually got what I ordered. Specifically ordered the silver version of the watch but I got gold instead. Also, the watch had scratches on the face.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: An old standard did not disappoint.
customer_reviews.text: The product remained true to the style that I originally bought (maybe) 40 years ago!? It looks the same and I assume runs the same although the price has risen (of course) over time. Yes, I know there are many more fancy, much more expensive and more stylish watches available. But, I'm an old time (69) and have always had one of these as my go to "dress" watch. (PS - I'm a runner and have also used the Timex 100 lap Ironman sports watch for many years.)
customer_reviews.author: Russ & Sammie

customer_reviews.title: Better than good,  Its great!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing this same watch for several years; when the battery dies I just get a new; this is a fine watch......it gives accurate time; wakes you in the morning; tell you the date and day which comes in handy after you retire (even in the dark) ; Has a nice expandable band that last as long as the battery; Has a stop watch.....What more could you want???? It even has clought....people see you with this watch on and ther say to themsleves "Now there goes a smart man".
customer_reviews.author: Boy Roy

customer_reviews.title: timex stretch band mens watch.
customer_reviews.text: no frills watch, works good.(had it for a few months so far, no problems) I have bought this brand many times over past 20yrs. Usually lasts about a year before the watch band pin slots get ripped away from the plastic pin holes (yes they look like shiney Crome, but NOT) or the batterie dies. but I like the Stretch band, it helps to keep it from breaking unlike riggid bands when it gets snagged on stuff. (yes its annoying the first couple of weeks, but eventually the wrist hair pulling stops, once its all been pulled out) over all ..Have and Will buy again...its a fair product at a fair price.
customer_reviews.author: McHandsome

customer_reviews.title: I like the straightforward programming
customer_reviews.text: This is new. I have had this watch before, and, it appears to be the same as always. The last one survived a long time. I like the straightforward programming. This is a no nonsense watch, easy to use and durable. I don't know what else to say other than it blows Casio out of the water, and Armitron no longer makes anything similar.
customer_reviews.author: Richard F. Newell

customer_reviews.title: When it is not available in the stores...
customer_reviews.text: This is the exact watch my cousin was wearing when it quit after who knows how many years. he searched and searched and could not find the exact same watch. I did a google search and for me a page came up that showed lots of indiglo watches, I forwarded the link to him, he found the right watch, I ordered it prime and presented it to him on fathers day. He was very excited and happy.
customer_reviews.author: Brian L. Every

customer_reviews.title: Non functional
customer_reviews.text: When it was delivered the watch didn't work, so thought it was the battery. Took it to a jeweler he was about to put in a new battery but the original battery was fine - something wrong with the watch itself. Amazon is good with picking up this return.
customer_reviews.author: MaryM

customer_reviews.title: which is quite good for these watches
customer_reviews.text: I've had this watch for quite a while now. It's off by a second or two per day, which is quite good for these watches. I reset it about once a week. It looks good and is easy to reset. I like the gold appearance and the Indiglo light. I've been very happy with it and would buy another.
customer_reviews.author: PDX-TBH

customer_reviews.title: A great watch at a small price
customer_reviews.text: I have had a TIMEX INDIGLO for at least 15 years or more. Keeps good time - great for swimming - an very good buy. When the battery gives out instead of a replacement battery I just get a new watch. Very reasonable price for a good time piece.
customer_reviews.author: Karl L. Reitter

customer_reviews.title: Need good eyesight
customer_reviews.text: I am getting older, having a little problem reading smaller things, and the day on this watch is hard for me to see, and the date is a little easier, but I still have to look close. Other than that, it keeps good time, and the watchband will last longer than the rubber ones, I hope.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: This is classic in the sense that it’s outdated. The calendar does not go to the year 2020.
customer_reviews.text: Not only was the technology outdated but they packed the watch in a padded envelope. Of course the box got crushed. Very poorly thought out. Look for and buy the T 80. It’s the classic look with the updated electronics and calendar. There is a reason this watch was cheaper. Pay the 20 extra bucks and get the T 80.
customer_reviews.author: scott p.

customer_reviews.title: Nice time piece.
customer_reviews.text: This is like the 5th one of this type of this watch I’ve had in the last 30 years. I have been this watches worst enemy. I’ve lost time, broken them or just plain wore them out. As you can see I really love this style of watch. A great product at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Margie Genzer

customer_reviews.title: Very good watch with one exception.
customer_reviews.text: I like the watch, sleek, clear to read, and low profile to fit underneath a shirt sleeve. The only problem is locating the operation manual online and the item mentioned by others about the inadequate size of the band. Seems designed for early teenager. I had to cajole a jeweler into adding three links that do not match the others in order to use it.
customer_reviews.author: BTWMS

customer_reviews.title: This was my fourth or fifth Timex Indeglo, and the first silver one.
customer_reviews.text: My first four or five Timex Indeglo were gold and I was happy with the look. However after a couple of years the gold metal on the back was being attacked by my skin oils or something and would become raised and developed sharp edges that would irritate my wrist. That is why I decided to try the silver version, and I hope that this doesn't develop the irritation causing sharp raised metal blisters. Incidentally, my first watch battery lasted 7 years. Wish they all lasted that long. I do like the Timex Indeglo watches.
customer_reviews.author: Vic Hart

customer_reviews.title: love this retro style watch.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this watch for well over a year now so feel like its time for a review, it has exceeded my expectations and would buy again. It has held up very nicely, although others said it wouldn't no issues with the finish or fit.
customer_reviews.author: Big Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great value for me.
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying these literally for decades. So glad they haven't stopped making them and haven't changed them. I use them till the battery won't let me see the time any longer (couple of years at least) then get a new one because I usually have the face so scratched up by then that's it's difficult to see anyway. I abuse these terribly and they just keep going. For the dollar these are perfect for me. Hope they keep on making them.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, Smooth... Worth the Buy.
customer_reviews.text: It was quick and easy to set up the time and date upon arrival. The feel is comfortable. And while I am slow in removing the watch, in avoidance of possibly tearing it apart, the watch has yet to strap onto my arm hairs and cause pain like the many other watches I've had. Therefore, I'd recommend this watch to those with hairy arms, too. Cheap, smooth... worth the buy.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Vasqez

customer_reviews.title: I have had this style and model of watch for ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this style and model of watch for well over 10 years. Has always been reliable. The only issue is that the "frame" is actually plastic with a chrome covering. I had to stop wearing some of the previous versions because the "ears" where the band attaches would break off rendering the watch unusable.
customer_reviews.author: FeelingGood

customer_reviews.title: Does what you need it to.  Good watch for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality for the price. Crystal got a little scraped, maybe a little to easily. Polywatch should fix it. Band will fit average wrist perfectly, I have a larger wrist and it’s ever so slightly tight, but not uncomfortable by any means; wish I would have gotten the large band however. Would reccomend if you’re looking for a basic digital watch, and not something rugged or heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: The Paint Starts To Peel Immediately!!!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a very nice looking watch and it is a good size to not be in the way while doing everyday tasks, BUT, within a week of wearing it everyday, the gold paint on the sides of the face of the watch, by the buttons, started peeling away showing a nasty yellow colored plastic. I was under the impression that the entire watch was stainless steel or aluminum. It’s a nice watch and I enjoy it but you get what you pay for. If you want a watch for a less practical purpose; IE: a dress watch, find another watch that won’t start to peel within a week.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe Quinn

customer_reviews.title: I'll wear it.
customer_reviews.text: It's an attractive watch and I really like the Indiglo; however, the day of the week is very hard to read, and the set buttons are difficult to press. Also, the watch band is sized for a small wrist. I find the directions for setting the time are confusing; you need to set the time immediately after passing the "chrono" setting, but don't look for a "time" label: there isn't one. It's not bad for an inexpensive watch, but doing it again, I would look for a larger display and larger buttons.
customer_reviews.author: emanon

customer_reviews.title: I may return this. It does NOT come with ...
customer_reviews.text: I may return this. It does NOT come with a manual. However the link on the Timex site does NOT include this watch. I am presently waiting for an email back from Timex to resolve this problem. I knew Timex was inexpensive, however I did not realize that it was SO cheap to not include a manual, or at least have the link on their site point to the correct watch.
customer_reviews.author: Gene mc

customer_reviews.title: Bought 3x, Broke 3x - STAY AWAY
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of this watch. I've bought it three times. Unfortunately, it has also broken three times - and always breaks within a few months of wearing. The band always detaches from the top of the watch face. Timex Support has been a nightmare. After my third of this exact watch broke after only 2 months of sporadic wear, I reached out to Timex to alert them of this issue. Every time, they tell me to pay to get my watch repaired. They do not acknowledge any defect or issues, and take no accountability.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and does all I want
customer_reviews.text: I had this watch for over 10 years. It got stuck on stopwatch mode. Since I doubted a low battery would have this effect, I just bought the exact same watch again. It fits me comfortably. I take it off frequently and the strap is easy off and on with no signs of wear. It provides the few features I want, which are 24hr (military) time (this is optional), stopwatch, hourly chime (this is optional) and alarm (although it's been years since I used any alarm except the one on the oven).
customer_reviews.author: Peter J Webb

customer_reviews.title: Timeless classic
customer_reviews.text: This is my husbands favorite style watch, in 30 years I’ve only had to replace it twice! and that was because of work related damage not the watch. I’ve bought him newer models but they just end up in the drawer. So, I hope Timex keeps making this classic watch and just in case he destroys another one.
customer_reviews.author: Snowcat60Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Times
customer_reviews.text: Have had these for years and they work great Eventually the buttons on the side of mine quit working. I have 2 of these so I don't have to change the time for daylight savings time. I just switch watches.
customer_reviews.author: L. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: They just work!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned many of these over the past 20+ years. They are waterproof, durable and the batteries seem to last forever. I usually destroy the watch before I need a new battery. Regarding water: I swim with mine in both salt and fresh water and never had a problem. Wouldn't use it as a dive watch, but no worries about normal water activities.
customer_reviews.author: MJGym

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic watch. Terrible packaging
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to of found this Timex watch. For as long as I can remember my father has only worn this particular watch. 5 stars for the watch, its amazing and honestly will last a lifetime. Only replaced my father's current one because the band broke after years of use. 3 stars for the packaging. It honestly looked like someone ripped the box open to look at the watch then threw it together in an envelope. Good thing this watch is sturdy and survived. Just goes to show how tough it is. Can't wait to see the look my dads face when he opens this gift.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney Repo

customer_reviews.title: The watch looks, works great
customer_reviews.text: The watch looks, works great and exactly what I wanted. My only complaint, is that the watch didn’t come with instructions of how to set all of the functions. I had to search for video that explained the processes.
customer_reviews.author: Drummerdoc

customer_reviews.title: SmallBand
customer_reviews.text: The wrist band is not as large as they say it is, I specifically ordered this for the expansion band and they advertise its a large wrist band; No it is NOT. I've wore Timex watches for over 25 years and they are tough watches but it doesn't do any good if you don't wear it because it small.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: Same watch as the last 4 I bought
customer_reviews.text: I like the style and twist band. I needed a replacement to the one that got lost. By the time the battery starts to go, the tiny push buttons are getting worn, so I just buy a new watch instead of replacing the battery
customer_reviews.author: Paul Hossler

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality!
customer_reviews.text: Wristband holder broke at the watch connection - I thought it was a fluke so I bought another - same thing happened! Don’t buy this - it’s faulty!
customer_reviews.author: Coach c

customer_reviews.title: Tough watch,
customer_reviews.text: Been wearing these watches for a long time,heavy equipment mechanic and they are tough this is new and I scraped it already .last one lasted 5 years as a work watch.still works except light not working.
customer_reviews.author: sandfourme2

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful vintage inspired watch that I got plenty of compliments ...
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful vintage inspired watch that I got plenty of compliments for but after awhile of wearing it one of the bands disconnected, now I'm left with a watch I can't wear! It was fair for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Nice watch and band
customer_reviews.text: Watch arrived on time, and ready to set up functions. However, the watch didn't have any instructions included in the box. shame on Timex and whoever shipped this product without instructions. I love the band, stays in place on my arm. I like the watch now, but would love it more if I had the instructions to set it up. Would buy again, really nice band for smaller wrists.
customer_reviews.author: charles p

customer_reviews.title: Best watch for years
customer_reviews.text: My husband had an older watch just like this and loved it....as the decades went by, the backlight dimmed and he had trouble seeing some of the setting numbers. So I bought him this as a replacement and it is just like his original one. He (and I) are delighted to see that nothing has changed and that this watch is really a CLASSIC.
customer_reviews.author: reggiereader

customer_reviews.title: Easy to find replacement bands. “Takes a licking and keeps on ticking” time, after time. (Sorry, I couldn’t help myself.)  :)
customer_reviews.text: Gift for my husband. This is the style he likes and it’s the fourth one that we have purchased, so far. While I liked the band that came with it, my husband prefers the mesh one with the clasp. Timex always has been an awesome watch, but my husband, the mechanic, can be rough on the bands.
customer_reviews.author: D. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Keeps excellent time and is rugged
customer_reviews.text: Time is accurate to better than 1 minute a year. This is the 3rd or 4th I have had and they usually last 5-8 years on the original battery. I use the Indiglo feature sparingly which saves battery. Very rugged. The stretch band fits well. At some point they went to a plastic back but it has not caused any problems. DST or Standard time changes and leap year need to be changed manually.
customer_reviews.author: B&C_Y

customer_reviews.title: Worth every cent!
customer_reviews.text: Had this style watch for the last 15 or so years. It is a great watch. It takes a beating from everyday use. I can swim with it on so I know it's waterproof. Cheaper to buy to watch than the battery which is what I do. Excellent watch for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Mark D.

customer_reviews.title: No instruction
customer_reviews.text: This Timex is made in Philippine. Printing a an instruction sheet there would cost about 5 cents. Timex has a web site for instruction for all their more expensive watches, but not this one. You have to send them an email and asking for one and after a week they email you one, otherwise it is good accurate inexpensive watch
customer_reviews.author: jeffkj

customer_reviews.title: My husband keeps buying this watch over and over and over
customer_reviews.text: Really can no longer purchase this watch locally, but my husband keeps wanting to wear only this watch. He loves the twist-o-flex watch band, the size, the digital reading, and of course the light.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

product_meta.title: Timex Men's Classic Digital Watch
product_meta.description:
The refined 80s retro style of the Classic Digital Dress Stainless Steel Expansion Band Watch gives your wardrobe a refreshingly sophisticated twist.




PRODUCT DETAILS
 * Is Discontinued By Manufacturer :No
 * Product Dimensions :7 x 1.34 x 0.04 inches; 1.6 Ounces
 * Item model number :T78587
 * Department :Mens
 * Batteries :1 Lithium Metal batteries required. (included)
 * Date First Available :May 2, 2004
 * Manufacturer :Timex
 * ASIN :B000B545A0

 * Amazon Best Sellers Rank: #38,139 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry (See Top 100 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry)  *  #142 inMen's Wrist Watches 
    *  #9710 inMen's Shops 
   
   

 * Customer Reviews:4.5 out of 5 stars2,759 ratings The refined 80s retro style of the Classic Digital Dress Stainless Steel Expansion Band Watch gives your wardrobe a refreshingly sophisticated twist.
feature_bullets: Silver-tone 18mm stainless steel expansion band fits up to 7-inch wrist circumference
100-hour chronograph with lap & split times; month, day & date calendar
Alarm; 24-hour military time mode; 2 time zones
Silver-tone 34mm resin case with acrylic lens; green digital display; Indiglo light-up watch dial
Water resistant to 30m (100ft): in general, withstands splashes or brief immersion in water, but not suitable for swimming or bathing
